questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters is using Journey Builder to send emails to loyalty members based on recent activity. They anticipate that approximately half of their contacts will meet the entry criteria for their journey.
How should they configure their entry source?

choices.D: Use a Query Activity in Automation Studio to create a segment before entering the journey.
choices.C: Use a Data Extension Entry Source with an applied filter based on recent member activity.
choices.B: Use a Contact Data Entry Source to segment the data configured in Attribute Groups in Contact Builder.
choices.A: Use an Import Activity in Automation studio to filter the data as a Data Extension Entry Source.

discussion.content:
As Anacj linked in the article states "Don’t use a filter in the entry source to filter more than 50% of your contacts when there are more than 500,000 total contacts. Doing this wastes critical compute resources and can lead to the system stopping your journey due to excessive resource usage. Instead, use an ETL tool such as Automation Studio to segment your data before using the data in Journey Builder."
which would suggest D is a better solution than C IF there are more than 500k total contacts

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to automate the daily segmentation of their master subscriber data extension into smaller data extensions based on subscriber preferences.
Which two Automation Studio activities could they choose from to segment their data into existing data extensions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD is Correct
AD - B is incorrect because that activity do not work with data extension only with list.

choices.C: Enable send logging to a data extension during send process.
choices.A: Ensure the values to log exist in the Additional Email Attributes.
choices.D: Use the WriteToLog() AMPscript function the content.
choices.B: Match an AMPscript variable name to a Send Log field.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC correct since "At send-time, data is written to the SendLog and can be added to in a couple of different ways;
Fields in the Sending Data Extension match the Field name of the SendLog Data Extension
AMPScript variable name matches the Field Name of the SendLog Data Extension
Personalisation Strings match the Field Name of the SendLog Data Extension
System default Personalisation strings match the Field Name of the SendLog Data Extension (ie %%EmailAddr%%)"

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters is sending email messages using Marketing Cloud Connect through the Sales Cloud user interface. All of their sends initiated from Sales
Cloud have a status of failed.
What should the consultant do to diagnose the issue?

choices.A: Ensure the System User is assigned the Standard User Profile.
choices.D: Manually clear the OAuth token to refresh the connection.
choices.C: Initiate a log to troubleshoot package-related API calls.
choices.B: Change the connection option to Scope by User.
